channel.title: Help!
channel.description:
When I sent my friend my client download and he clicked run it said "Java is not recognized as an internal or external command". It works for everyone else but not him.
The code in run.bat is [code]@echo off title Client java -Xmx300m client pause[/code] and he has a 64bit operating system. Can anyone give me a code to put in his run.bat?

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Vexillum, post:3, topic:431040”]I put that code in then I had to change to (x86) because that was where my friends Java was located and now I get this error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: client : Unsu pported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Please help…[/quote]
so the 1 before (x86) worked for you??

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

I put that code in then I had to change to (x86) because that was where my friends Java was located and now I get this error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: client : Unsu pported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Please help…

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Vexillum, post:1, topic:431040”]When I sent my friend my client download and he clicked run it said “Java is not recognized as an internal or external command”. It works for everyone else but not him.

The code in run.bat is @echo off title Client java -Xmx300m client pause and he has a 64bit operating system. Can anyone give me a code to put in his run.bat?[/quote]
this also happens to me, it’s easy to fix though… Just follow this simple step.

STEP 1:

replace the original code with this one:

@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx300m client pause

Edit:

If the first code doesn’t work then try this:

@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx300m client pause

Read full topic
